ChunkText: no special authorization or application is required from isss you are simply allowed to do this as a benefit of your immigration status. on campus jobs can be defined as any job that is physically on campus and paid by umbc.
ContextBefore: on-campus work f-1 international students are able to work up to 20 hours per week on campus during the fall and spring semesters, and up to 40 hours per week on campus during the summer and winter vacations.
ContextAfter: common examples are work done in any campus office, the library or rac gym, food services, the book store, or graduate assistantship positions including tas, ras and gas. a few exceptions exist please contact the isss office if you are not sure if a job you are considering would classify as on campus.
